snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500 index closed at a record high  following a last-minute deal to avoid a U.S. default, but weak earnings pulled the Dow industrials slightly lower.
abstract: Stocks rise as Wall Street puts government shutdown and debt ceiling crisis behind it to focus on corporate earnings.
lead_paragraph: The Standard & Poor’s 500 index closed at a record high  following a last-minute deal to avoid a U.S. default, but weak earnings pulled the Dow industrials slightly lower.

headline.main: S.&P. Hits New High as Market’s Focus Shifts
headline.print_headline: S.&P. Hits New High as Market’s Focus Shifts
